name: Abell Cauthon
info: [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s father. He is the best horse trader in the Two Rivers. He wins the quarterstaff competition at Bel Tine almost every year, and when he does not, [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor) does. He came to Tar Valon at one point to find out if Mat was still alive.

name: Adine Canford
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She receives messages from [Nieda](#Nieda-Sidoro) when [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) is away.

name: Alanna Mosvani
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. She helps to Heal [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) from the evil of the dagger from Shadar Logoth. She is known for her temper and sense of humor.

name: Aldieb
chapter: Chapter 7: The Way Out of the Mountains
info: The white mare that [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) rides. Her name means “West Wind” in the Old Tongue.

name: Aleria Elffin
info: A woman about whom humorous tales have been written. The book is part of [Mother Guenna](#Mother-Ailhuin-Guenna)'s library.

name: Alsbet Luhhan
info: Wife of [Haral Luhhan](#Haral-Luhhan), blacksmith of Emond's Field. She is a very big woman, almost as big as her husband.

name: Aludra
chapter: Chapter 40: A Hero in the Night
info: Woman who seeks shelter in the same barn that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) were sleeping in in Aringill. She was cast out of the Illuminators' Guild because she was blamed for spoiling the performace for King Galldrian of Cairhien. The problem was actually [Tammuz](#Tammuz)'s fault (or so they thought), but she was a more convenient target.

name: Alviarin Freidhen
info: Aes Sedai of the White Ajah. She was present at [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s testing for Accepted.

name: Amico Nagoyin
info: Youngest of the Black Sisters who fled the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin). She is only four years older than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Amyrlin Seat
info: Chief position among the Aes Sedai. She is elected unanimously by the Hall of the Tower, and is considered to be of all Ajahs and at the same time of none. The office carries considerable influence; kings and queens, even if they hate Aes Sedai, will come if the Amyrlin calls them. The office is currently held by [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), raised from the Blue Ajah.

name: Amys
info: Wise One of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. Her dreams said that [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc) must go west of the Spine of the World to search for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn).

name: Anaiya
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She is the one who “tests” [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to see if she is a Dreamer. She is described as “motherly.”

name: Arent
info: Ogier of Stedding Shangtai, father of [Loial](#Loial) and son of [Halan](#Halan).

name: Aried
info: Father of [Jalanda](#Jalanda), son of [Coiam](#Coiam).

name: Artur Hawkwing
info: Name by which [Artur Paendrag Tanreall](#Artur-Hawkwing) was known during his conquest of the world.

name: Asmodean
info: One of the Forsaken. He was an accomplished artist and musician during the Age of Legends, but was never the best around. It was this feeling of inadequacy that caused him to forsake the Light.

name: Atuan Larisett
info: Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah who teaches history in the White Tower. She told [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) that the Tower could probably not make the Stone of Tear today, even if every sister helped.

name: Avendesora
info: The Tree of Life of legend. The tree is the last of the Chora Trees, products of the Age of Legends. The location of _Avendesora_ is unknown, though it apparently has some connection with the Aiel; they gave the people of Cairhien a gift over 500 years ago of a tree, _Avendoraldera_, that was grown from a cutling of _Avendesora_.

name: Avendoraldera
info: Tree grown from a cutling from _[Avendesora](#Avendesora)_, the legendary Tree of Life. It was a gift for the Cairhienin from the Aiel over 500 years ago. When [King Laman](#Laman-Damodred) cut it down, it precipitated the Aiel War.

name: Aviendha
info: Aiel of the Bitter Water sept of the Taardad Aiel. She is _Far Dareis Mai_, a Maiden of the Spear. She is the woman who jumps in front of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), as well as the one who follows them and helps free them when they are captured.

name: Ba'alzamon
info: Ancient name from the Trolloc Tongue, believed to be the Trolloc name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One). It means “Heart of the Dark,” in the Old Tongue. Ba'alzamon claims to have sent the Trollocs during the Trolloc Wars for over three hundred years, told [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing) to send armies across the Aryth Ocean, and told the same Hawkwing to refuse the Aes Sedai Healing that could have saved his life and proclaim with his last breath that Tar Valon must fall.

name: Bain
info: Aiel of the Black Rock sept of the Shaarad Aiel. Her hair is flame-colored. She became [Chiad](#Chiad)'s first sister—the two had to sneak through the camp of the other to the Wise Ones because their clans were (and still are) in blood feud.

name: Bair
info: Wise One of the Haido sept of the Shaarad Aiel. Her dreams said that [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc) must go west of the Spine of the World to search for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn).

name: Banas
info: Old widower from Jarra who marries [Jorath](#Jorath) when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) comes through Jarra. Like his new wife, he once swore that he would never marry again.

name: Basel Gill
info: Innkeeper of the Queen's Blessing, an inn in Caemlyn. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) stayed there on their way through Caemlyn (before the battle at the Eye of the World), and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) and Mat stay there when Mat is in Caemlyn to deliver [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s letter.

name: Be'lal
info: One of the Forsaken. He has taken up residence in Tear after being released from the Bore, convincing the High Lords of Tear to raise him up as a Lord of the Land, [High Lord Samon](#High-Lord-Samon).

name: Bela
info: [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s shaggy mare. She originally belonged to [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor), but [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) put her into use as Egwene's transportation.

name: Beldeine Nyram
chapter: Chapter 22: The Price of the Ring
info: [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere) in the world of the testing _ter'angreal_. Of the Green Ajah. Beldeine was stilled by [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan) and others, and forced to betray Egwene in order to channel again.

name: Bennae Nalsad
info: Aes Sedai who teaches history in the White Tower, of the Brown Ajah. She once said that Andor and Cairhien fought in more wars with each other than any two nations besides Tear and Illian.

name: Berelain sur Paendrag Paeron
info: First of Mayene. She comes to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) with a message from [Lanfear](#Lanfear) about “[Lews Therin](#Lews-Therin-Telamon)” (actually [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)) being “hers” and that she is entrusting him to their care temporarily. Berelain was not certain why she agreed to serve as a messenger, only that it “seemed right.” Lanfear no doubt used a Compulsion weave on her.

name: Bili
info: Big man, bigger than [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), who keeps order in Easing the Badger.

name: Boanne
info: Songmistress at Taralan, the Fourth Age. She wrote _Do'in Toldara te_, “Songs of the Last Age.”

name: Brandelwyn (Bran) al'Vere
chapter: Chapter 40: A Hero in the Night
info: Innkeeper and Mayor of Emond's Field; [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s father. He cuffed (struck) [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) when he was young for cutting open a firecracker.

name: Brendas
info: Cool-eyed Aes Sedai of the White Ajah who helps to separate [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) from the dagger from Shadar Logoth.

name: Canin
info: Captain of the _Darter_, the ship that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) take from Jurene to Tear.

name: Captain Adden
info: Captain of a leaky boat to which the men who kidnapped [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) are taking the three unconscious women.

name: Captain Derne
info: Captain of the _Swift_, the ship [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) take to Tear. He has a square face.

name: Cavan Lopar
info: Innkeeper of the White Crescent, an inn in Tear where [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) look for [Comar](#Comar).

name: Chesmal Emry
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Yellow. She was one of the most talented Healers in years.

name: Chiad
info: Short, blonde Maiden of the Spear. She is of the Stones River sept of the Goshien Aiel. She became [Bain](#Bain)'s first sister—the two had to sneak through the camp of the other to the Wise Ones because their clans were (and still are) in blood feud.

name: Coiam
info: [Jalanda](#Jalanda)'s grandfather, [Aried](#Aried)'s father.

name: Coke
info: One of the men who kidnapped [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).

name: Coline
info: Huge cook of the Queen's Blessing, an inn in Caemlyn. Everyone calls her “[Cook](#Cook).”

name: Comar
chapter: Chapter 46: A Message Out of the Shadow
info: One of the two men [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) overhears while inside the palace in Caemlyn. He is given orders to see that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) dies quietly as well as for [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara)'s heads (as well as Elayne's) to be brought to him. The other man, the man who gave the orders, was [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril).

name: Cook
info: Name that all people except [Basel Gill](#Basel-Gill) refer to [Coline](#Coline) by.

name: Coram
info: One of the Aiel.

name: Corianin Nedeal
info: The last Dreamer in the White Tower, an Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She died 473 years ago. [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) gives [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) a _ter'angreal_ that Corianin used throughout much of her life, hoping that she will be able to use it to explore her own Talent for Dreaming.

name: Coulin
chapter: Chapter 14: The Bite of the ThornsChapter 15: The Gray ManChapter 16: Hunters Three
info: Master of Arms in the White Tower. He keeps a tight discipline among the men who come to train with the Warders.

name: Dailin
info: Red-haired Aiel, of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel. She is Healed by [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) after being attacked by swordsman.

name: Dain Bornhald
info: Son of [Geofram Bornhald](#Lord-Captain-Geofram-Bornhald). [Jaret Byar](#Jaret-Byar) was sent to tell him how his father had died. Dain was the leader of the band of Whitecloaks that stopped [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), and [Hurin](#Hurin) near Tar Valon.

name: Dark One
info: Most common name, used in every land, for [Shai'tan](#Dark-One).

name: Daughter-Heir (of Andor)
info: By Andoran tradition, the oldest daughter of the Queen succeeds her on the Lion Throne. No man is allowed to be King, at least not as more than a figurehead. The previous Daughter-Heir, [Tigraine](#Tigraine-Mantear), disappeared over twenty years ago; the current Daughter-Heir is [Elayne Trakand](#Elayne-Trakand). It is also traditional for the Daughter-Heir and her oldest brother (who will become First Prince of the Sword when she becomes Queen) to train in Tar Valon, but Elayne is the first Daughter Heir, indeed, the first ruler of any kind in recent memory, to actually have enough ability to channel that she will become Aes Sedai.

name: Davian
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) of old times. [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon) claims that he was used by Aes Sedai, just as all other false Dragons were.

name: Dena
info: Woman who was an apprenticed to [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin). She had long brown hair and dark eyes to match. She loved Thom, and Thom returned her love, despite the fact that he was old enough to be her father. She was killed by thugs in Cairhien who were trying to kill Thom and Dena due to Thom's supposed involvement in the Great Game.

name: Dermid Ajala
info: Blacksmith in the Star, an inn in Tear. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) helps him with his work while they are staying in the Star.

name: Dhael
info: One of the Aiel.

name: Doral Barran
chapter: Chapter 40: A Hero in the Night
info: Wisdom of Emond's Field before [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara). She switched [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) for cutting open a firework when he was young.

name: Dragon Reborn
info: According to the _Karaethon Cycle_, the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon), the Dragon Reborn is the man who is the Rebirth of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon), the man known as the Dragon during the War of the Shadow. Over the years, many men have claimed to be the Dragon Reborn, even men who could not channel. The true Dragon has been Reborn in a young man named [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), a shepherd from Emond's Field.

name: Dyelin Taravin
info: Next in line to the Lion Throne (the throne of Andor) after [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Egwene al'Vere
info: Young woman from Emond's Field. She has the ability to channel the One Power inborn, as did her Wisdom [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), and [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) took her along to Tar Valon so she could learn some control over it. This probably saved her life, since three out of four women who have to learn the way Nynaeve did do not survive. Egwene has long dark hair and dark eyes. It was generally expected that she would marry [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), but the two ended up loving each other more as siblings—besides the fact that Rand is the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), a fact which would impede a lot of the progress in their lives. She is a good friend of [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), the Daughter-Heir of Andor.

name: Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, and former advisor to [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor. Morgase refused to take Elaida back to Caemlyn when she found out that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) was missing.

name: Elayne Trakand
info: Novice in the White Tower. She is the Daughter-Heir of Andor, daughter of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), sister to [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand), and half-sister to [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred). She lives next door to [Egwene al'Vere](#Egwene-al-Vere); the two are good friends.

name: Elber
chapter: Chapter 46: A Message Out of the Shadow
info: Guard at the gates to the Queen's palace in Caemlyn. He is fat and has eyes like a rat. He tries to have [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) arrested when he says he comes from Tar Valon.

name: Ellisor
info: Captain of the _Blue Crane_, the ship [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) take to Tear. He was anxious to get rid of the three passengers, since they always seemed to be seasick.

name: Elmindreda (Min) Farshaw
info: Young woman from Baerlon. She dresses in men's clothing, a habit she picked up while assisting her father in his mine. She has dark eyes and dark hair. She has a special talent, that of seeing images or auras around people that predict their futures. Min does not think the ability is all that great, since her viewings often forecast death, pain, or other unpleasant circumstances for those they represent. One of her viewings surprised her: she is destined to fall in love with [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), but is also destined to “share” him with two other women.

name: Else Grinwell
info: Novice in the White Tower. [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) stayed at her parents' farm when they were traveling to Caemlyn. She has eyes for men, according to Mat. She delivers a message to [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) to look through the things from [Liandrin](#Liandrin) and her fellow Black Sisters' things under the library. The really strange part is the fact that Else was dismissed from the Tower several days earlier for failing to do her work....

name: Elyas Machera
chapter: Chapter 3: News From the PlainChapter 4: Shadows SleepingChapter 5: Nightmares Walking
info: A man, once a Warder, who can talk to wolves. He helped [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) discover his ability when he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) were separated from the rest of their group and chanced upon his campsite. He lives in company of wolves all the time, and has the same yellow color to his eyes that Perrin has. He taught Perrin that he _can_ communicate with wolves, but he did not tell him how to keep from losing touch with the human inside him.

name: Faile Bashere
info: Name [Zarine Bashere](#Zarine-Bashere) chooses for herself. Meaning “falcon” in the Old Tongue, she thinks it a name worthy of a Hunter of the Horn.

name: Faolain Orande
info: Dark, curly-haired Accepted. She escorts [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) to their rooms after they come back from Falme. She is only slightly older than Nynaeve. She has a dislike for wilders. Egwene thinks it very likely that Faolain will choose the Red Ajah.

name: Father of Lies
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Gaidin
info: Name that [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) gives to her horse. She named him after [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), since Warders are called “Gaidin” by their Aes Sedai.

name: Gainor Furlan
info: Innkeeper of Wayland's Forge, the inn [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), [Loial](#Loial), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) stay at in Remen. He reports of Hunters of the Horn, as well as Whitecloaks and even Aiel in the city.

name: Galadedrid (Galad) Damodred
info: A young man from Caemlyn, son of [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred) and his first wife, [Tigraine](#Tigraine-Mantear), and half-brother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). He is studying with the Warders in the White Tower, and is their star pupil. He is stunningly handsome, and has a crush on [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Gareth Bryne
info: Captain of the Guards and First Prince of the Sword under [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand). The First Prince of the Sword is usually the Queen's eldest brother, but Morgase had no living brothers, so she chose Bryne to fill the position. He was dismissed after growing too vocal about his dislike for [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril). After her husband's death and after she exiled [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin), Bryne was the queen's lover.

name: Gaul
info: Aiel of the Imran sept of the Shaarad Aiel. He is _Shae'en M'taal_, a Stone Dog. [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) rescues him from his entrapment in Remen. He is searching for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn), the man prophesied to unite the Aiel and lead them from the Waste. He is also one of the Aiel who stops [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) on the rooftop.

name: Gawyn Trakand
info: Son of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, brother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and half-brother to [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred). He will be First Prince of the Sword if Elayne assumes the Lion Throne. He is in Tar Valon training with the Warders, and he and Galad are the two best students. Gawyn has feelings for [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), but refuses to act on them because Galad likes her as well. However, Egwene returns his feelings and does not return Galad's.

name: Gilda
info: Serving girl in the Queen's Blessing, an inn in Caemlyn. According to [Basel Gill](#Basel-Gill), she is the world's biggest gossip, and the perfect person to tell about a fabricated dream in which he learned that [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril) plotted to kill [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Grassburner
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Guaire Amalasan
chapter: Chapter 22: The Price of the Ring
info: Man who proclaimed himself to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) about a thousand years ago. He could channel quite strongly. His armies attempted to free him before he was gentled. He took over much of the world, laid siege to the Stone of Tear, and might have taken the rest of the world if a young _ta'veren_ king, [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing), had not risen to power at the same time.

name: Guardsman-Lieutenant Martyn Tallanvor
chapter: Chapter 46: A Message Out of the Shadow
info: Guardsman-Lieutenant in the Queen's Guards who takes [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) to the Queen of Andor so he can deliver the letter [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) sent her. He will die for [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand), but does not think much of her new advisor, [Gaebril](#Lord-Gaebril).

name: Gyldan
chapter: Chapter 22: The Price of the Ring
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah who appears in [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s viewings inside the testing _ter'angreal_. She was [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s closest confidante and clearly also a Darkfriend (in the world of the _ter'angreal_, at least). She tried to stop Egwene from escaping from the Tower; Egwene folded her with a punch between the eyes, a move she was very glad [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) taught her.

name: Halan
info: Ogier of Stedding Shangtai, father of [Arent](#Arent) and grandfather of [Loial](#Loial).

name: Hamada
info: [Moilin](#Moilin)'s mother, [Juendan](#Juendan)'s daughter.

name: Hammar
info: Warder in charge of teaching the sword in the White Tower. He likes to smoke while instructing, using the pipe to gesture. He let [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) challenge [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand) to a two-swords-on-one-quarterstaff fight. He expected Mat to win, and that the incident would serve to humble Galad and Gawyn. He was right.

name: Haral Luhhan
info: Blacksmith of Emond's Field. He was [Perrin Aybara](#Perrin-Aybara)'s mentor at the forge. He is a very large, well-built man, perfect for striking at the forge.

name: Harilin
info: Person after which Harilin's Leap, an inn in Jarra, is named.

name: Harod
info: Innkeeper of Harilin's Leap, an inn in Jarra. He keeps a good house, according to [Simion](#Simion).

name: He Who Comes With the Dawn
info: Man the Aiel are searching for. He is prophesied to lead the Aiel out of the Three-Fold Land, born of their blood but raised by wetlanders.

name: Heartfang
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One). The wolves use it for [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon)

name: Heartsbane
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: High King Artur Paendrag Tanreall
info: Full name of [Artur Hawkwing](#Artur-Hawkwing), a young king of a minor province who eventually conquered much of the known world during his lifetime, and even laid seige to Tar Valon in hopes of taking over all lands east of the Aryth Ocean and west of the Aiel Waste. He was the most strongly _ta'veren_ person in all of history except [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), so strong that people claimed they could almost “feel” the Pattern bending around him when they were in the same room. His death set off the War of the Hundred Years.

name: High Lord Darlin Sisnera
chapter: Chapter 51: Bait for the NetChapter 52: In Search of a RemedyChapter 53: A Flow of the SpiritChapter 54: Into the Stone
info: High Lord of Tear, and a good swordsman. He is very arrogant, and tells [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) that he would be privileged if he died with High Lord Darlin's sword through him. Mat manages to disable him with his quarterstaff.

name: High Lord Samon
info: A High Lord of Tear. He was raised quite recently and quickly.

name: Hopper
info: One of the wolves. Hopper died, at least in the world of the flesh, but his spirit lives on in _Tel'aran'rhiod_, the World of Dreams.

name: Huan Mallia
info: The captain of the _Gray Gull_, the ship [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) take to Aringill (in Andor). He has a great reverence for the [High Lord Samon](#High-Lord-Samon), a recently raised High Lord of Tear.

name: Huan
info: [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche)'s uncle. He liked to gamble. Siuan says that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) reminds her of him. Huan died while rescuing children from a burning house.

name: Hurin
info: Thief-taker for the king of Shienar. He is lean, and has long hair. He is also a “sniffer”—one who can “smell” evil, even where it was done in the past.

name: Ilyena Therin Moerelle
info: Wife of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon). [Lanfear](#Lanfear) refers to her as a “straw-haired chit.” This is because Lanfear loved Lews Therin, and he returned her love before he met Ilyena.

name: Ishamael
info: Most powerful of the Forsaken. His name means “Betrayer of Hope.”

name: Jaichim Carridin
info: Inquisitor of the Hand of the Light; a Questioner. This band is much like the Spanish Inquisition, using torture to extract what it already knows to be the truth from its subjects.

name: Jaim Adarra
info: Captain of _Snow Goose_, the ship [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) hires to take them away from Remen.

name: Jaim Dawtry
chapter: Chapter 22: The Price of the Ring
info: Someone who brings [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) and [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) al'Thor odd news from Baerlon in the world of the testing _ter'angreal_. He says people are at war fighting the “Shawkin,” “Sanchan,” or “something like that.” Jaim lives in Emond's Field in the real world, as well, but this message came during Egwene's test for being Accepted.

name: Jain Farstrider
info: Hero of legend from Malkier who had many adventures. There is a book about him, _The Travels of Jain Farstrider_, that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) intends to read but never has. The book is quite popular with his friends. His real last name is Charin.

name: Jalanda
info: Son of [Aried](#Aried) son of [Coiam](#Coiam). Ogier who called [Be'lal](#Be-lal) “The Envious,” and said that he forsook the Light out of envy for [Lews Therin](#Lews-Therin-Telamon).

name: Jaret Byar
info: Officer among the Children of the Light with dark, deep-set eyes and a scraggly face. He comes to [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) with news of the battle at Falme. According to Niall, he is not very imaginative.

name: Jearom
info: The greatest Blademaster of all time. He fought over 10,000 times in battle and in single combat. He was only defeated once—by a farmer with a quarterstaff.

name: Jeral Florry
chapter: Chapter 40: A Hero in the Night
info: Innkeeper of the Good Queen, the inn in whose stable [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) spend part of the night in while in Aringill.

name: Joiya Byir
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the White. She was the eldest of those that left the Tower with [Liandrin](#Liandrin). She is old enough to be [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s grandmother.

name: Joiya al'Thor
chapter: Chapter 22: The Price of the Ring
info: Daughter of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) al'Thor in the world of the testing _ter'angreal_.

name: Jolien
info: Aiel of the Salt Flat sept of the Nakai Aiel. She has blue eyes and red-gold hair.

name: Jon
info: Blacksmith of Jarra. He married [Rilith](#Rilith), precipitating a wave of marriages throughout Jarra. He is old enough to be her father.

name: Jorath
info: Old widow from Jarra who marries [Banas](#Banas) when [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) comes through Jarra. Like her new husband, she once swore that she would never marry again.

name: Juendan
info: [Hamada](#Hamada)'s mother, [Moilin](#Moilin)'s grandmother.

name: Juilin Sandar
info: Thief-catcher in Tear. One of the most dangerous people that [Mother Guenna](#Mother-Ailhuin-Guenna) knows of. He carries a notched sword-breaker and narrow staff; he is deadly with both.

name: Jurah Haret
info: Innkeeper of the Star, the inn in Tear where [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), and [Zarine](#Zarine-Bashere) stay.

name: Jurith Dorine
info: Right Hand to the Queen of Almoren in 742 AB, the Third Age. She wrote _Commentaries on the Prophecies of the [Dragon](#The-Dragon)_.

name: Kadar
info: Character in one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories.

name: Kari al'Thor
info: Wife of [Tam al'Thor](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor). She raised [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) until she died about five years after his birth. She grew up in Caemlyn.

name: Keeper of the Chronicles
info: Essentially the secretary to the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). The Keeper is traditionally chosen from the same Ajah the Amyrlin was raised from, and wears a stole of the color of her Ajah instead of the striped stole of the Amyrlin. The post is currenlty held by [Leane Sharif](#Leane-Sharif) of the Blue Ajah. In theory, the Keeper of the Chronicles serves the Amyrlin Seat and speaks for the Amyrlin Seat; she is all but separate from her Ajah, although less so than the Amyrlin Seat herself.

name: King Easar Togita
info: King of Shienar. His palace is in Fal Moran.

name: King Galldrian su Riatin Rie
chapter: Chapter 40: A Hero in the Night
info: King of Cairhien, Defender of the Dragonwall. He died in the riots that accompanied [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s departure.

name: King Madel
info: Character in one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories. He has a fish stuck in his beard.

name: Kinslayer
info: Name given in fear to [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) after he killed his family and everyone he ever loved in madness.

name: Laman Damodred
info: King of Cairhien before the Aiel War. In order to build his new throne, Laman cut down _[Avendoraldera](#Avendoraldera)_, a Chora tree that grew in the center of the city of Cairhien. This act, known as Laman's Sin, prompted three clans of the Aiel to cross the Spine of the World and avenge the death of the tree by taking his life. The tree had been a gift from the Aiel in gratitude for the hospitality the people of Cairhien had displayed to them in the past. It is unknown whether Laman knew of the significance of _Avendoraldera_, or of the reason the Aiel allowed the people of his kingdom to cross the Waste. The fact that he cut the tree down and brought the Aiel over the Dragonwall allowed Prophesy to be fulfilled and the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) to be born on the slopes of Dragonmount, born of the ancient blood (Aiel) and raised by the old (Manetheren). He is [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s uncle.

name: Lanfear
info: One of the Forsaken. Unlike the rest of the Forsaken, whose names were chosen for them by those they betrayed, Lanfear chose her name herself, which means “Daughter of the Night” in the Old Tongue. Besides her name, the only thing known about her is that during the Age of Legends, before [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) met [Ilyena](#Ilyena-Therin-Moerelle), she was his lover. She believes that Lews Therin's _soul_ is hers, no matter whose body it now inhabits.

name: Laras
chapter: Chapter 28: A Way OutChapter 29: A Trap to Spring
info: Mistress of the Kitchens (actually just the head chef) in the White Tower. She is more than just stout, and has many chins.

name: Leafblighter
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Leane Sharif
info: [Keeper of the Chronicles](#Keeper-of-the-Chronicles) under [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche). She was raised from the Blue Ajah, the same Ajah as Siuan. She has short, dark hair, copper-colored skin, and is as tall as most men. She grew up in Arad Doman.

name: Leuese Mulan
info: Man who pulled up three heartstone bowls and a cup in his fishnets. He did not even know the half of their value until [Mother Guenna](#Mother-Ailhuin-Guenna) told him, and after word got around, even the High Lords were out in their boats trying to bring up more _cuendillar_.

name: Lews Therin Telamon
info: The [Dragon](#The-Dragon), Lord of the Morning, Breaker of the World. He was perhaps the most influential man who ever lived, and the most powerful Aes Sedai ever. He led the strike which resealed the [Dark One](#Dark-One) back into his prison, ending the Age of Legends and beginning the Time of Madness. Unfortunately, Lews Therin was driven insane along with the rest of the Hundred Companions with whom he resealed the prison; he went mad and killed everyone he loved as well as anyone who carried so much as one drop of his blood. For this reason, he was given the name Kinslayer, and his name is generally associated with evil, especially among the uneducated. He is especially despised by the Whitecloaks, the “Children of the Light,” who by their very name should be serving him. It is unfortunate that one of the greatest men who ever lived is as feared and despised as he is.

name: Leya
info: A Tinker, a Tuatha'an, one of the Traveling People, who meets [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), [Uno](#Uno-Nomesta), [Masema](#Masema-Dagar), [Ragan](#Ragan), and the rest of their party with urgent news for [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred).

name: Liandrin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah. Before she and twelve others left the White Tower, she masqueraded as a member of the Red Ajah. She attempted to “give” [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) to the Seanchan, and actually did give [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) to them. She has a face like a doll.

name: Lion
info: Name of the horse that [Orban](#Lord-Orban) rides.

name: Logain Ablar
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who led Ghealdan, Altara, and Amadicia to civil war before being captured and gentled by Aes Sedai. He was quite strong in the One Power.

name: Loial
info: Ogier from Stedding Shangtai, son of [Arent](#Arent) son of [Halan](#Halan). He is young for an Ogier at ninety, which for an Ogier is not even old enough to be outside the _stedding_ alone without permission of the Elders. He is fond of books, and is rarely seen without one.

name: Lord Agelmar Jagad
info: Lord of Fal Dara, and commander of Shienar's army. He is one of the best field commanders alive.

name: Lord Brend
info: Man who recently ascended to the Council of Nine in Illian. The rest of the Council seems to take his words to heart.

name: Lord Captain Commander Pedron Niall
info: Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light. He has dark eyes and graying hair. He is the most powerful man among the Children, and even posesses king-like powers in Amadicia, where the Whitecloaks are based.

name: Lord Captain Eamon Valda
info: Officer of the Children of the Light. He commands [Dain Bornhald](#Dain-Bornhald). He is stationed near Tar Valon. [Geofram Bornhald](#Lord-Captain-Geofram-Bornhald) questioned his motives and worried that Dain would follow his orders blindly.

name: Lord Captain Geofram Bornhald
info: Lord Captain of the thousand or so Whitecloaks who died at Falme. He died with his men. He was the commander of the troops who captured [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere); when Perrin killed some of his men, Bornhald vowed to take Perrin back to Amador to be hanged. Despite this, he may have been one of the few Whitecloaks who saw beyond the propaganda of the Children, using his own wisdom to judge people instead of insisting everyone not in white cloaks was in league with the Shadow.

name: Lord Gaebril
info: New advisor to [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, selected as [Elaida](#Elaida-do-Avriny-a-Roihan)'s replacement. [Gareth Bryne](#Gareth-Bryne) did not like him all that much, so Bryne was dismissed to his farm. Gaebril plans to invade Cairhien, since Morgase has a claim to the Sun Throne by her marriage to [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred). [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) overheard him talking to [Comar](#Comar) about orders to kill [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand).

name: Lord Gann
info: One of the men who captured one of the Aiel and killed the other when they got too close to the city of Remen. He claimed there were twenty of them, when in fact there were only two.

name: Lord Orban
info: Dark-haired young man with a bandage around his forehead. He is also bandaged from knee to ankle on his left leg. He and [Gann](#Lord-Gann) claimed to have fought twenty Aiel and survived. In reality, they only fought two.

name: Lord of the Grave
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Lord of the Twilight
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Lothair Mantelar
info: Author of _The Way of the Light_ and founder of the Children of the Light.

name: Luaine
info: One of the Aiel.

name: Mada
info: Serving woman in The Woman of Tanchico, an inn in Tar Valon at which [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) tells stories and at which [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) stops on his way out of town. Thom describes her (while drunk, at least) as being very pretty. Mat thinks she and [Saal](#Saal) may be sisters; Mada is the older of the two.

name: Mandarb
chapter: Chapter 7: The Way Out of the Mountains
info: The black stallion that [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) rides. [Zarine](#Zarine-Bashere) tries to assume this name since it means “Blade,” and she thinks it a proper name for a Hunter of the Horn. She decided against it when [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) told her that Lan's horse was named Mandarb.

name: Mara
info: Character in a song that [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) sings, “Mara and the Three Foolish Kings.”

name: Marin al'Vere
info: Wife of [Bran](#Brandelwyn-Bran-al-Vere), mother of [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).

name: Marillin Gemalphin
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the Brown. Extremely fond of cats and of helping injured animals.

name: Marris Thornhill
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. [Leane](#Leane-Sharif) sends [Faolain](#Faolain-Orande) to her to “contemplate [that leading is neither pushing nor pulling] while raking the paths in the Spring Garden.”

name: Masema Dagar
info: Shienaran soldier who accompanies [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) on his missions to find [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s messengers. He has a triangular scar on his face.

name: Master Andra
info: Name [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) uses while in other lands to avoid questions about his real name.

name: Masuto
info: Shienaran soldier. He gets the wrong idea about [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) and [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) when he sees them talking by the fire.

name: Matrim (Mat) Cauthon
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_, and has considerable luck with random events, such as dice games. He went to Tar Valon to be separated from the dagger he carries, a dagger tainted with the evil of Shadar Logoth.

name: Mazrim Taim
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) from Saldaea. He can channel the One Power, and is of considerable strength. At last report, Aes Sedai were on their way to gentle him. He was captured by a mob after a blinding flash knocked him senseless at the moment [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) declared himself as the true [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Melaine
info: Wise One of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel. Her dreams said that [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc) must go west of the Spine of the World to search for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn).

name: Mist
info: Name that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) gives to her horse, hoping that it will be of even temperament.

name: Mistress Alys
info: Name that [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) uses in Remen and other nations to avoid misunderstandings about her true identity.

name: Mistress Aynora
info: A woman in a song [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) knows. She owns a rooster.

name: Mistress Caryla
info: Name that [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) assumes while on board the _Darter_, the ship she, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) take from Jurene to Tear.

name: Mistress Joslyn
info: Name that [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) assumes when on board the _Darter_, the ship she, [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) take from Jurene to Tear.

name: Mistress Mari
info: Name [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) goes by in Illian.

name: Mistress Maryim
info: Name that [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) assumes while on board the _Darter_, the ship she, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) take from Jurene to Tear.

name: Mistress of Novices
info: Aes Sedai in charge of novice training in the White Tower. She serves as both a disciplinarian and a shoulder to cry on for girls who need either (or both). The current Mistress of Novices is [Sheriam Bayanar](#Sheriam-Bayanar) of the Blue Ajah.

name: Modrellein
chapter: Chapter 14: The Bite of the ThornsChapter 15: The Gray ManChapter 16: Hunters Three
info: Queen of Andor around 700 years ago. In the battle of Cuallin Dhen, she rode alone and unarmed into the midst of the Tairen army with the Lion banner. The army rallied to protect her, and won the battle. _Often confused with the recent queen of Andor, Mordrellen Mantear._

name: Moilin
info: Daughter of [Hamada](#Hamada) daughter of [Juendan](#Juendan). Ogier who called [Be'lal](#Be-lal) “Netweaver.” She said that he bragged about the one thing that he bettered [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) in, a game of stones.

name: Moiraine Damodred
info: Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. From even before she became a full sister, she dedicated her life to finding the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). She was a good friend of [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) when she was in training. Moiraine was able to track the whereabouts of the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) to a small village in western Andor, Emond's field, where she narrowed the list of candidates to three young men, all of whom were _ta'veren_, who were born within days of each other. She guided these three away from Emond's Field, until an encounter at the Eye of the World revealed which of the three was truly the one: [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), who she found was actually born near Tar Valon on the slopes of Dragonmount and brought to Emond's Field by his adoptive father, [Tam](#Tamlin-Tam-al-Thor). Moiraine bears much importance in the White Tower, and is involved in actions which many of her fellow sisters would think to be treason, actions she would most likely be stilled for if their full extent were known. These sisters do not understand just how important the Dragon Reborn actually is.

name: Moonhunter
info: Name the wolves use for [Lanfear](#Lanfear).

name: Morgase Trakand
info: By the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, Protector of the People, High Seat of House Trakand. Mother to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). She was trained in the White Tower, as all Queens of Andor have, but was too weak in the One Power to do anything worthwhile with the knowledge she learned there.

name: Morning Mist
chapter: Chapter 3: News From the PlainChapter 4: Shadows SleepingChapter 5: Nightmares Walking
info: One of the wolves. She is the sole survivor of the pack which attacked the last “Neverborn” when they attacked the camp where [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and the Shienarans were staying.

name: Mother Ailhuin Guenna
info: Wise Woman (the Tairen equivalent of a Wisdom) in Tear. She helps [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara) and grants them a place to stay during the night.

name: Mother Leich
info: The Wisdom, Wise Woman, etc. equivalent in Remen.

name: Mother Roon
info: Wisdom-like person in Jarra. She was unable to offer any kind of help for [Noam](#Noam).

name: Myrelle Berengari
chapter: Chapter 7: The Way Out of the Mountains
info: Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah. [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) has arranged to pass [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran)'s bond to her in the event Moiraine dies before Lan does. Moiraine jokingly explains that she is someone who Lan must deliver a package to for safekeeping. Lan knows that _he_ is the parcel, but does not know that the intended recipient is someone he already loves....

name: Nico
info: Stablehand in Harilin's Leap, an inn in Jarra.

name: Nieda Sidoro
info: Innkeeper Easing the Badger. She greets “[Mari](#Mistress-Mari)” in front of Easing the Badger. She is one of the eyes-and-ears for the Blue Ajah.

name: Noam
info: Man from Jarra; [Simion](#Simion)'s brother. He is similar build to [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), and has the same ability to talk to wolves. Unlike Perrin and [Elyas](#Elyas-Machera), Noam has lost any sense that he was ever human.

name: Nynaeve al'Meara
info: Young woman from Emond's Field. She is seven years older than [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere).  She was the Wisdom before leaving home. She was appointed the Wisdom at a very young age, mostly as a result of being able to “listen to the wind” and because of her ability to heal people. She did not know it at the time, but she now knows that these abilities are manifestations of her ability to touch _saidar_, the female half of the True Source. She has considerable potential, more than any Aes Sedai in recent times, possibly since the Age of Legends, but that potential is blocked. Nynaeve had to learn control of the Power by herself, without Aes Sedai guidance, and to protect herself created a block to her channeling which only comes down when she is angry or using her medicines.

name: Old Grim
info: Name that [Zarine](#Zarine-Bashere) uses for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Orander
info: Character in one of [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin)'s stories.

name: Ordeith
info: [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall)'s foremost servant; he also serves as his advisor. He is a bony man with a “huge beak of a nose.” He is the only person (besides Niall himself) who knows of a secret passage into Niall's chamber, which Niall suspects he uses for eavesdropping. The name “Ordeith” means “Wormwood” in the Old Tongue.

name: Patrim
info: Stablehand in Harilin's Leap, an inn in Jarra.

name: Perrin Aybara
info: Young man from Emond's Field. He is _ta'veren_. [Byar](#Jaret-Byar) believes it was Perrin who betrayed [Bornhald](#Lord-Captain-Geofram-Bornhald)'s legion to the Seanchan. Perrin is a large man, and very cautious—he found it was easy to forget how big he was and really hurt other children when he was young, so he is careful not to act too quickly. He discovered that he can talk to wolves while he and [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) were separated from the rest of the group between Aridhol and Caemlyn, when he encountered [Elyas Machera](#Elyas-Machera). Elyas helped him learn about his ability, but not how to keep from losing his human side in the process. The wolves refer to him as “[Young Bull](#Young-Bull).” He carries a curved battle ax and recently acquired a blacksmith's hammer which he sometimes carries in place of the ax. Perrin also possesses the ability to enter what he calls the “Wolf Dream,”, the World of Dreams. In the Wolf Dream, Perrin can communicate with all wolves, living or dead.

name: Piesa
info: The horse who carries [Leya](#Leya) to meet [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). She is not used to the rough terrain they had to cover, but she managed.

name: Raab
info: Sea Folk sailor who follows [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) around on his gambling rounds. He always lost to Mat, so he started bidding against others that Mat would win. He made a handsome profit.

name: Ragan
info: Youngest of the Shienarans who accompany [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) on his missions to find [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s messengers.

name: Rahvin
info: One of the Forsaken.

name: Ramey
info: Stablehand in the Queen's Blessing.

name: Rand al'Thor
info: Young man from Emond's Field. It is his picture that appears in the drawings that [Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) receives. These drawings depicted the battle over the skies of Falme, in which Rand battled [Ba'alzamon](#Ba-alzamon). Rand is probably the most strongly _ta'veren_ individual who ever lived, with the possible exception of [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon). Rand can channel the One Power with incredible strength, and is destined to fight the [Dark One](#Dark-One) in the last battle—he is the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). Rand is not convinced of his destiny, and plans to “test” it by going to Tear to see if he can take _Callandor_, the Sword That is Not a Sword, the Sword That Cannot Be Touched.

name: Raolin Darksbane
chapter: Chapter 22: The Price of the Ring
info: Man who proclaimed himself to be the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) before the Trolloc Wars began. He was the first false Dragon of significance who could channel. His armies attempted to free him before he was gentled.

name: Rhuarc
info: Clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. He was once _Aethan Dor_, a Red Shield. He and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) have similar temperaments. His sept is the Nine Valleys sept.

name: Rianna Andomeran
info: Aes Sedai of the Black Ajah, formerly of the White. She has black hair with a white streak above her left ear.

name: Rilith
info: Daughter of the weaver of Jarra. She precipitated the series of marriages by asking [Jon](#Jon), the blacksmith, to marry her, despite the fact that she is young enough to be his daughter. She was probably influenced by the presence of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and his _ta'veren_ quality pulling at the Pattern.

name: Rogosh Eagle Eye
info: Hero of Legend who is one of those called back by the Horn of Valere. [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) thinks not even _he_ would ask for the adventures Mat had had over the past few days.

name: Rosel of Essam
info: Someone who wrote books around the year 200 A.B. (after the Breaking). She claimed that over 100 pages of a book [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin) has the sole surviving page of survived the Breaking; Verin has studied the one page that still survives thousands of times. The book supposedly contained secrets that Rosel thought the world was not prepared to face.

name: Saal
info: Serving woman in The Woman of Tanchico, an inn in Tar Valon at which [Thom Merrilin](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) tells stories and at which [Mat Cauthon](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) stops on his way out of town. Thom describes her (while drunk, at least) as being very pretty. Mat thinks she an [Mada](#Mada) may be sisters; Saal is the younger of the two.

name: Sammael
info: One of the Forsaken. His name means “Destroyer of Hope” in the Old Tongue.

name: Sanor
info: Large crewman on the _Gray Gull_, the ship [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) take to Aringill (in Andor).

name: Sarien
info: The other Aiel who came with [Gaul](#Gaul). He died, and Gaul was imprisoned. The villagers say there were twenty, but in reality there were only the two of them.

name: Seana
info: Wise One of the Black Cliffs sept of the Nakai Aiel. Her dreams said that [Rhuarc](#Rhuarc) must go west of the Spine of the World to search for [He Who Comes With the Dawn](#He-Who-Comes-With-the-Dawn).

name: Selene
info: Woman who dresses in all white and silver. She visits [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) in the White Tower. She claims that she was in the Tower for some other purpose and just dropped by to see him. She is the most beautiful woman Mat has ever seen.

name: Serafelle
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She helps to Heal [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) from the evil of the dagger from Shadar Logoth.

name: Shai'tan
chapter: Chapter 55: What is Written in Prophecy
info: True name for the Dark One. Saying his true name draws his attention, so many euphemisms for him have been developed, including Heartfang, Leafblighter, Lord of the Grave, Heartsbane, Soulsbane, Lord of the Twilight, and Father of Lies. He is considered to be the complete antithesis of the [Creator](#The-Creator), and the source of all evil. He has been bound in a prison the Creator made for him since the beginning of time. This prison was bored into during the Age of Legends, and was temporarily re-sealed by [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) and the Hundred Companions. Those seals are now growing weak (three have broken already), and the Dark One's influence is spreading.

name: Sharbon
info: Body servant of [Jaichim Carridin](#Jaichim-Carridin).

name: Shepherd of the Night
info: Alternative name for the Dark One.

name: Sheriam Bayanar
info: [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) in the White Tower. She is an Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. Trips to her study are feared (with reason) by novices and Accepted alike.

name: Sightblinder
info: Aiel name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Silvie
info: Old woman Egwene meets in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Ugly does not begin to describe her. She has a bony, pointed chin; a bony, sharp nose; and warts all over her face.

name: Simion
info: Chinless groundskeeper of Harilin's Leap, an inn in Jarra. He reports to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) that there have been “a lifetime of weddings” in the two days prior to their arrival. These were probably due to the presence of [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor), who is strongly _ta'veren_. He also asks Moiraine to help his brother [Noam](#Noam), who is sick.

name: Siuan Sanche
info: Watcher of the Seals, the Flame of Tar Valon, the [Amyrlin Seat](#Amyrlin-Seat). She has blue eyes. She is quite fond of fish analogies, a result of being raised on a fishing boat in Tear. Siuan is one of only three Aes Sedai that knows that [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor) is the Reborn",Dragon Reborn. After [Liandrin](#Liandrin) and the other twelve sisters that went with her left the Tower, Siuan has been afraid to trust anyone except [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), and [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin), thinking that anyone else, possibly including [Leane](#Leane-Sharif), her Keeper of the Chronicles, could be Black Ajah without her knowing. This paranoia is probably the safest course, but causes an increased level of tension in the Tower.

name: Soulsbane
info: Alternative name for the [Dark One](#Dark-One).

name: Stepper
info: [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara)'s horse, a dun stallion with quick feet.

name: Tamlin (Tam) al'Thor
info: Father of [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor). According to [Selene](#Selene), Tam came to Tar Valon along with [Abell Cauthon](#Abell-Cauthon) to find out if Rand and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) were still alive. Tam is from Emond's Field, but he left for several years to fight as a member of the Illianer army. He rose to Blademaster status, and acquired a heron-mark sword, which is now in Rand's possession. He married a woman from Caemlyn, [Kari](#Kari-al-Thor), and then was called to duty to fight the Aiel in the Aiel War. During the Battle of the Shining Walls near Tar Valon, he found a young boy on the slopes of Dragonmount, which he adopted and took back to Emond's Field. Tam had no idea that this child was the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn).

name: Tammuz
chapter: Chapter 40: A Hero in the Night
info: One of the men who comes to kill [Aludra](#Aludra). He is an Illuminator. He was the one who was at fault (or so Aludra believes) when the display for [King Galldrian](#King-Galldrian-su-Riatin-Rie) went awry, but she was blamed for it since she was the Mistress of the Chapter House.

name: Taringail Damodred
chapter: Chapter 46: A Message Out of the Shadow
info: Late husband of [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) of Andor, and father to [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred), and [Gawyn](#Gawyn-Trakand). His first wife was the former Daughter-Heir of Andor, [Tigraine](#Tigraine-Mantear).

name: The Creator
info: The entity who created the world; in short, God. He has a strict policy of not directly interfering with worldly events, instead using a “Chosen One” to do what must be done. The last “Chosen One” was [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon); the current one is [Rand al'Thor](#Rand-al-Thor).

name: The Dragon
info: Name by which [Lews Therin Telamon](#Lews-Therin-Telamon) was known during the War of the Shadow. His Rebirth, the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn), is now alive and fulfilling all of the prophecies set to accompany him.

name: Theodrin Dabei
info: Accepted with a willowy neck and coppery skin. She moves gracefully. She was a wilder, one who learned to channel by herself before coming to the Tower. Like [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), Theodrin had a block that inhibited her channelling for a time. She learned how to knock hers down, and plans to help Nynaeve do the same.

name: Thom Grinwell
chapter: Chapter 46: A Message Out of the Shadow
info: Alleged brother of [Else](#Else-Grinwell). [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) pretends to be him so that he has an excuse to have been in Tar Valon. He claims he is from Comfrey, north of Baerlon.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: Former court bard in the Royal Court of Andor, now a gleeman. He came to Emond's Field on Winternight, and left with [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran), and [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) on their journey. He saved Rand's life by facing a Myrddraal long enough for Rand to escape, and managed to escape. He is an expert at _Daes Daemar_, the Game of Houses; he could and does play it in his sleep.

name: Tigraine Mantear
info: [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand)'s step-mother, in a way (her father's first wife). She is also [Galad](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred)'s mother. [Damodred, Galadedrid](#Galadedrid-Galad-Damodred); [Trakand, Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand); [Trakand, Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand).

name: Uno Nomesta
info: Shienaran soldier, chief among those with [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara). He is missing his left eye and has a long scar down the left side of his face. He has a very foul tongue, a habit of which [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) is trying to break him of. He wears his hair in standard Shienaran warrior style: shaved head except for a topknot.

name: Vasa
info: Large crewman on the _Gray Gull_, the ship [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) and [Thom](#Thomdril-Thom-Merrilin) take to Aringill (in Andor).

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah. She accompanies [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), [Hurin](#Hurin), and [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) from Falme to Tar Valon. One of only three Aes Sedai to know that the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn) lives.

name: Willim of Manaches
info: Man who wrote a book of essays that [Mother Guenna](#Mother-Ailhuin-Guenna) owns.

name: Wormwood
info: Name [Pedron Niall](#Lord-Captain-Commander-Pedron-Niall) calls [Ordeith](#Ordeith) to spite him. It is the literal meaning of the name “Ordeith.”

name: Young Bull
chapter: Chapter 3: News From the PlainChapter 4: Shadows SleepingChapter 5: Nightmares Walking
info: Name that the wolves use to refer to [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara).

name: Yurian Stonebow
info: False [Dragon](#The-Dragon) who declared himself circa 1300 AB and was captured and gentled circa 1308 AB. He had great potential with the One Power.

name: Zarine Bashere
info: Dark-haired woman that latches onto [Perrin](#Perrin-Aybara) and the group he's with. She is from Saldaea, but left home to become a Hunter of the Horn in Illian. She followed Perrin, [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred), and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran) because she thought they would lead her to the Horn of Valere. She was dissapointed to find out that [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) had already blown it, and was shocked to find that [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) is the [Dragon Reborn](#Dragon-Reborn). She uses the name Faile, a name her father used to call her, meaning “falcon.” This scared Perrin, since he'd been told by [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw) that she saw a falcon and a hawk fighting over him in her visions. Faile looks as if she has taken a liking to Perrin, and Perrin may be doing the same for her.

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
info: Uncrowned king of Malkier, a nation now swallowed by the Great Blight. For years, he fought a one-man war against the Shadow in the Blight, until being bonded as a Warder by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). Lan is one of the best Warders, but he is very hard and stubborn, and is thus hard for Aes Sedai to deal with. He keeps a stone countenance, never revealing his true feelings to anyone—although sometimes he cannot hide his feelings for [Nynaeve](#Nynaeve-al-Meara).
